key_facts: GTA 6 is expected to feature next-gen AI according to public speculation.
AI in games typically refers to scripted decision trees or generative models like ChatGPT.
NPCs in GTA 5 use hard-coded behaviors such as patrolling and taking cover.
Generative AI can produce real-time dialogue, as demonstrated in a Matrix mod.
Rockstar has previously used in-game media systems like Weasel News and fake commercials.
The social media system in GTA 6 trailers appears prominently featured.
A viewer named Dement suggested NPCs could post crime footage on in-game social media.
Terrence T20 proposed that AI could generate unique NPC faces, names, voices, and backstories.
Baron Vanhausen88 theorized that AI could procedurally generate interiors for properties in GTA 6.
Rockstar filed a patent in 2017 (US2019019290871) for generating virtual spaces using modular templates.
The patent was not used in Red Dead Redemption 2, suggesting it's intended for GTA 6.
Rockstar values narrative control, polish, and quality assurance in their game design.
Procedural generation of interiors would likely involve pre-approved assets vetted by developers.
AI-generated content in games requires significant development cycle processing.
Voice consistency and immersion are prioritized over fully dynamic AI voice generation.

Procedurally generated interiors offer replayability but carry risks if layouts feel unrealistic.
Rockstar will likely use AI as a tool during development rather than at runtime.

The idea of AI-driven property listings adds value to gameplay without compromising polish.

Player-driven media integration enhances immersion without requiring full AI autonomy.
AI should be used to augment, not replace, human-designed content in Rockstar games.
